Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech by allowing a small group of ACMA members to decide what constitutes misinformation.
There is a concern about the disparity in who gets to speak their version of the truth and who gets silenced.
The bill could limit engagement and contributions from a diverse population, affecting equal opportunity.
The government has previously been proven wrong in court, suggesting that their version of truth is not always accurate.
The bill is seen as a step towards censorship and dictatorship, undermining democratic principles.
Notable Quotes: The prospect of freedom of speech being curbed or decided upon by a small minority of six members of ACMA is concerning and simply makes no sense.

A democratic society operates on free speech and ideas. Censoring information and disallowing individuals the choice to use their critical thinking skills, turns democracy into a DICTATORSHIP, does it not?
